issue.title: narvar.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://returns.narvar.com/rei-co-op/returns

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

@@||returns.narvar.com^$stealth=ip

Fixes forbidden error

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Bump husky from 8.0.3 to 9.0.7

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky) from 8.0.3 to 9.0.7.
Release notes

Sourced from husky's releases.

v9.0.7

  • fix: typo and source ~/.huskyrc correctly (compatibility with v8)
  • docs: fix example by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1363

v9.0.6

  • docs: add favicon by @​rakleed in typicode/husky#1354
  • chore: apply editorconfig to code only by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1355
  • docs: update install script to mjs and fix CI checks by @​starnayuta in typicode/husky#1357
  • Fix unbound variable by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1359

v9.0.5

  • docs: update path to startup files by @​ManuelRauber in typicode/husky#1350
  • fix: init error by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1353

v9.0.4

  • fix: init create dir before by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1348
  • refactor: simplify by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1349
  • fix: init not working on pnpm #1334 by @​rozbo in typicode/husky#1347

v9.0.3

  • docs: fix link by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1340
  • chore: fix links in issue template by @​julien-f in typicode/husky#1341
  • fix: add scripts field if not present by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1338
  • docs: changelog link by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1343
  • fix: insert final newline by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1339
  • fix: fix git hooks path on windows by @​rozbo in typicode/husky#1346

v9.0.2

  • fix: exit code by @​gergelypap in typicode/husky#1336
  • docs: typo by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1337

v9.0.1

TLDR;

Improved user experience and a (even) smaller package size while packing in more features!

Note: install using husky@latest to get the bug fixes that were released after.

👋 By the Way

I'm available for remote work (Front-end/Back-end mainly JS/TS but open to other stacks Rails, Go, Elixir). You can contact me at my mail: typicode at gmail :slightly_smiling_face:

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 9e08ef0 chrore: bump version
  • 04d7407 fix: typo in sourcing ~/.huskyrc
  • 800fbf1 docs: fix example (#1363)
  • c1bbd9b style: indent
  • 2da78cb 9.0.6
  • 797dfdf Fix: unbound variable (#1359)
  • e7ada20 docs: update install script to mjs and simplify (#1357)
  • 534bfed chore: apply editorconfig to code only (#1355)
  • f446351 docs: add favicon (#1354)
  • 8314bef 9.0.5
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

pull_request.title: Bump husky from 8.0.3 to 9.0.7
pull_request.body:
Bumps [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky) from 8.0.3 to 9.0.7.
Release notes

Sourced from husky's releases.

v9.0.7

  • fix: typo and source ~/.huskyrc correctly (compatibility with v8)
  • docs: fix example by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1363

v9.0.6

  • docs: add favicon by @​rakleed in typicode/husky#1354
  • chore: apply editorconfig to code only by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1355
  • docs: update install script to mjs and fix CI checks by @​starnayuta in typicode/husky#1357
  • Fix unbound variable by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1359

v9.0.5

  • docs: update path to startup files by @​ManuelRauber in typicode/husky#1350
  • fix: init error by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1353

v9.0.4

  • fix: init create dir before by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1348
  • refactor: simplify by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1349
  • fix: init not working on pnpm #1334 by @​rozbo in typicode/husky#1347

v9.0.3

  • docs: fix link by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1340
  • chore: fix links in issue template by @​julien-f in typicode/husky#1341
  • fix: add scripts field if not present by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1338
  • docs: changelog link by @​typicode in typicode/husky#1343
  • fix: insert final newline by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1339
  • fix: fix git hooks path on windows by @​rozbo in typicode/husky#1346

v9.0.2

  • fix: exit code by @​gergelypap in typicode/husky#1336
  • docs: typo by @​chalkygames123 in typicode/husky#1337

v9.0.1

TLDR;

Improved user experience and a (even) smaller package size while packing in more features!

Note: install using husky@latest to get the bug fixes that were released after.

👋 By the Way

I'm available for remote work (Front-end/Back-end mainly JS/TS but open to other stacks Rails, Go, Elixir). You can contact me at my mail: typicode at gmail :slightly_smiling_face:

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 9e08ef0 chrore: bump version
  • 04d7407 fix: typo in sourcing ~/.huskyrc
  • 800fbf1 docs: fix example (#1363)
  • c1bbd9b style: indent
  • 2da78cb 9.0.6
  • 797dfdf Fix: unbound variable (#1359)
  • e7ada20 docs: update install script to mjs and simplify (#1357)
  • 534bfed chore: apply editorconfig to code only (#1355)
  • f446351 docs: add favicon (#1354)
  • 8314bef 9.0.5
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: Husky v9
issue.body:
Update Husky to v9.

See migration guide: https://github.com/typicode/husky/releases/tag/v9.0.1

comment.body:
@ameshkov @Alex-302 There is an issue that you should know about. According to [the migration guide](https://github.com/typicode/husky/releases/tag/v9.0.1), Husky 9 no longer requires the presence of the following 2 lines in the hook scripts:

```sh
#!/usr/bin/env sh
  . "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"
```

The problem: if a dependency is updated in the GitHub repo, we have to update it in the local repo as well. This is currently automatic in the filters repo and is done through Husky's `post-merge` hook. So if the user pulls the changes and the `package.json` or `yarn.lock` changed between the old HEAD and the new HEAD, `yarn install --force` is automatically called. This is a convenient behaviour in this repo and helps keep the linter results consistent, no one forgets to update.

However, since Husky 9 no longer requires these 2 lines, and I removed them in this PR, the following will happen, if we merge this PR in its current form:
- the user currently has Husky 8 installed locally
- the user pulls the latest changes from GitHub, so the 2 lines disappear from their local `post-merge`
- the locally installed Husky 8 tries to run the new `post-merge` hook but won't be able to spawn because the shebang is missing

Also, `pre-commit` hook will fail for the same reason.

So there are two options:
1. the user manually calls the `yarn install --force` command in this case (then Husky 9 will be installed locally, the automatic process will work again) - no need to call it again manually after that
2. we keep the lines - in theory, Husky 9 is backwards compatible, although I don't know if it will ever be marked as deprecated, currently `.husky/_/husky.sh` is just an empty file in Husky 9 to avoid errors, we will probably have to make this change at some point anyway

What do you suggest?

comment.body: I don't see a problem with blocking it. I believe the reason paywalls are not blocked is because it would allow users to see content they did not pay for, which could result in legal issues. The thing I reported does not do that; it even has a little x button that lets you close it and keep reading.

comment.body: Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce ads in the application. Try to open the filtering log (3rd tab) , clear it, play ads in the app and then take screenshots of the filtering log. Requests like `amazon` and `appsflyer` should be blocked. Screenshots of the filtering log can be attached to a comment on github or sent to `filters@adguard.com`.

labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > For the last couple of days I've noticed a significant slowdown in loading Youtube pages with AdGuard enabled. I've updated all filters, but the apparent deliberate slowness does not go away unless I disable AdGuard and then Youtube appears to load correctly. issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS.

comment.body:
К сожалению, мы не можем воспроизвести проблему с вашими настройками.

Пожалуйста, попробуйте проверить обновления фильтров, возможно, проблема уже решена. Если вы все еще не смогли воспроизвести проблему, снова откройте ее здесь. Мы будем благодарны, если вы предоставите дополнительную информацию или скриншоты.
